talk_0034:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Both our local clothes and the Yiga Clan
outfits are made using Sheikah crafting
techniques, so they're good in rain...
But do you really have to wear that
around here?
talk_0005:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Please excuse me. I have to put my
daughters to bed.
NakedPlayer_01: It takes all kinds, I guess.
talk_0006:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I was just saying hello to my wife before
heading to the chief's house.

<sp:3:0:2:0300>My wife... She lost her life due to
my carelessness.

I can never make up for that. Even so, my
children and the village have forgiven me.

<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'll do my best to repay everyone's
kindness by helping <clr:0000>Lady Paya<clr:ffff>. It's...
It's the least I can do.
talk0014:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad_00>Even now, she's under one of the
<clr:0000>Ring Ruins <clr:ffff>with the Zonai Survey Team.
That ruin, over there.
talk_0007:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'll rest, sure. But first, I'll just look at my
daughters' sleeping faces a little longer.
Yes. Then I'll rest.
talk0015:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>I wonder... Maybe seeing you will remind
her about her responsibilities as <clr:0000>chief<clr:ffff>.

Would you do me a favor and stop by to
see <clr:0000>Lady Paya<clr:ffff>?
talk_0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Notice>Is that you, Link?


I've been a light sleeper ever since
my wife passed away.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Ah, no, please don't worry about me.
I'm used to waking up at all hours.

<sp:3:0:2:0700>But can't you sleep? Perhaps a <clr:0000>soft bed<clr:ffff>
at the inn will help. I've heard they're
very comfortable.
talk_0009:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Now that I think about it, with <clr:0000>five<clr:ffff> large
ruins crashing down, it's a miracle no one
was hurt.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>I wonder why <clr:0000>Zelda<clr:ffff> only <clr:0000>sealed off<clr:ffff> one
of them...

<sp:3:0:2:0701>Ah, please excuse me. My thoughts are
wandering today.

Anyway, I don't think there's another site
like the <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff> anywhere in Hyrule.
You should take a look.
talk_0010:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm on my way to visit my wife. I'll head
to the chief's house when I'm done.

It sure feels good to have Lady Paya back
in charge!
talk_0011:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Now that I think about it, with <clr:0000>five<clr:ffff> large
ruins crashing down, it's a miracle no one
was hurt.
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Greeting_00>And this miracle wouldn't have
meant a thing if it weren't for
Lady Paya's leadership.
*sigh* I just wish she weren't so focused
on the <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff>.

But she's come such a long way as chief.
And I plan to be there for her as she
continues to grow.
talk0019:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I... <sp:5:1:0>I...


<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>L-<sp:5:1:0>Link?!<sp:0:2:2:6400>


Why are you wearing that awful mask?!


<sp:3:0:2:0000>I haven't had a scare like that in a
long time...

But I could never mistake you for one
of the Yiga Clan.

<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Sad_00>*sigh* And right now, too, while our
chief is...
talk_0012:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Lady Paya is still young, so I understand
her enthusiasm with the <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff>.

<sp:3:0:2:0500>But, and this is just between us, I wonder
if it's more of an obsession. I hope she
realizes soon what it means to be <clr:0000>chief<clr:ffff>.
talk_0013:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>With that <clr:0000>Ring Ruin <clr:ffff>closed off, I can't
reach the cemetery... But it's the thought
that counts, not the place.
I'm sure my wife will hear my words
wherever I say them.
talk_0014:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I made a promise to my wife to protect
our children and the village she loved.

I'll fulfill my promise by helping <clr:0000>Lady<clr:ffff>
<clr:0000>Paya<clr:ffff>. And when I see our children's
smiling faces, it'll all be worth it.
talk_0016:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Recently, <clr:0000>Cottla<clr:ffff> has been coming home
<clr:0000>covered in mud<clr:ffff>. She won't tell me why.

Is this... Is this what they call the
"rebellious phase"?

<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I won't ask her about it. What if she thinks
I'm being too pushy? Or overbearing?
No, best to wait it out...
talk_0017:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice>Link?


If you can't sleep, try a <clr:0000>soft bed <clr:ffff>at the
inn. I've heard they're very comfortable.
talk_0019:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>You're right. When we pray, we'll
pray as a family.

<sp:3:0:2:0300><clr:0200><sp:0:2:2:5000>Oh, I'm so proud of the fine young women you're
growing up to be...<sp:0:2:2:6400><clr:ffff>
talk_0021:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad_01>The Ring Ruins may be important assets
to the village...

But it worries me to see her so obsessed.


<sp:3:0:2:0701>Hm. Perhaps seeing you would remind her
about her responsibilities as <clr:0000>chief<clr:ffff>.

Would you do me a favor and stop by to
see <clr:0000>Lady Paya<clr:ffff>?
talk_0022:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Ah, Link, pardon me.


<sp:3:0:2:0a01>I'm sorry, but <clr:0000>Lady Paya<clr:ffff> is still deep in
discussion with the Zonai Survey Team.
talk_0024:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I heard that Lady Paya helped Tauro and
company with their investigation.

With the mystery of the <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff>
sorted out, the village will flourish
more than ever. 
I was...I was wrong to think she
wasn't taking her responsibilities
as chief seriously.
In the end, Lady Paya was more
concerned for the village than anyone.
Talk_Greeting_03:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Ah, Link. Hard to believe it's night
already. Would you like to rest at
the inn?
talk_0025:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>That book contains findings from the
Zonai Survey Team.

Lady Paya has pored over it. I have no
idea how many times she's read it.

<sp:3:0:2:0500>I wish she brought the same enthusiasm
to her duties as <clr:0000>chief<clr:ffff>...
Talk_Greeting_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00>Link! You must be soaked through!


Unless... Do you have <clr:0000>armor made for
bad weather<clr:ffff>? 

Our clothes are specially made using
Sheikah technology. They keep us dry
in any weather.
I hope you have armor that does that too.
talk_0026:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>The village has thrived thanks to the
<clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff>, and that's a fact.

But sometimes I wonder if her enthusiasm
for them borders on obsession...

<sp:3:0:2:0500>When is she going to realize that she's
the <clr:0000>chief<clr:ffff>?
Talk_Greeting_05:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Think>Link... I don't know if you're attempting
to make a joke, but that mask is in very
poor taste.
talk_0027:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>That book contains findings from the
Zonai Survey Team.

Lady Paya has pored over it. I have no
idea how many times she's read it.

I used to think she cared more about the
ruins than she did about being <clr:0000>chief<clr:ffff>...

But I sure had it backward. Without her
focus, who knows what would have
happened to Tauro's investigation?
I just wish I understood sooner.
talk_0028:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>My wife's grave is by the ruin...


But Lady Paya and the others are busy
investigating. I don't want to get in
the way.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>No matter. It's the thought that counts,
not the place. I'm sure my wife will hear
our words wherever we say them.
talk_0029:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm just saying hello to my wife before
heading to the chief's house.

Her grave is by the ruins, but Lady Paya
and the others are busy investigating.
I don't want to get in the way.
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>Sometimes I wish she would do more as
the chief...

But when I see her so excited and
earnest, it's hard to bring it up.

<sp:3:0:2:0701>No matter. I'm sure my wife will hear our
words wherever we are.
talk0008:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_00>Good grief. It's <clr:0000>Lady Paya<clr:ffff>'s duty to take
care of the village...

But whenever I take my eyes off her,
she's elbow-deep in some trivial new
problem. I...<sp:5:1:0> Hm?
talk_0030:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseM_01>Wh...who's here? <sp:5:1:0>What are you doing in
my house?<sp:0:4:0>...<sp:5:1:0>
talk0009:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>Who...<sp:5:1:0> Is that really you...<sp:5:1:0>


<sp:0:2:2:7d00><sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>L-<sp:5:1:0>Link?<sp:0:2:2:6400>


Why, it's been some time! You gave me
quite a shock. I didn't expect to see you
appear here in our village.
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Sad_00>And right now, too, while our chief is...
talk_0002:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I was just saying hello to my wife before
heading to the chief's house.

With one of the <clr:0000>Ring Ruins <clr:ffff>closed off,
I can't reach the cemetery. But it's the
thought that counts, not the place.
I'm sure my wife will hear my words
wherever I say them.
talk_0031:
<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Ease>Oh... It was only you, Link.<sp:5:0:0> Please don't
startle me like that.<sp:0:4:0>I nearly laid hands on you, thinking that
you were a Yiga Clan assassin.
talk_0032:
<sp:3:0:2:0500>Why are you wearing an awful outfit
like that?

My insides turned to ice for a
moment there.
talk0010:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Sad_00>I'll bet you could find her with the Zonai
Survey Team right now. They're probably
by the <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff> near the chief's house.
talk_0003:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I'm going to the chief's house.


Lady Paya often has business elsewhere,
so someone needs to be there.
talk0011:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:TalkPositive_01>Ah, I suppose you haven't heard. The
former chief, Lady Impa, retired.

Now <clr:0000>Lady Paya<clr:ffff> is the <clr:0000>chief of Kakariko
Village<clr:ffff>. I've been working as her
assistant, but...
<sp:3:0:2:0c01><snd:Sad_01>Lady Paya is ignoring her responsibilities.
She won't listen to anything I say! All
these <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff> have her full attention.
talk_0033:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I have to say, I think dressing like that
is in very poor taste.
talk_0004:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>If just one of those <clr:0000>five<clr:ffff> ruins had fallen
a little differently, Kakariko Village might
have been wiped out. Scary, right?
Seemingly small things have such a big
impact. The <clr:0000>Ring Ruins<clr:ffff> landing next
door, <clr:0000>Lady Paya<clr:ffff> becoming chief...
The world as we know it is made up of
one tiny miracle after another.
